definition: to placate/to pacify/to appease
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
to ease (tension)/to alleviate/to moderate/to allay/to make more mild
tranquil/undisturbed/serene
mood/state of mind/moodiness/CL:種|种[zhong3]
to constrain or repress emotions/oppressive/stifling/depressing/repression
relieved/at ease/feel relieved
to reinstate/to resume/to restore/to recover/to regain/to rehabilitate
to dwindle/to vanish/to make vanish/to exercise restraint/to curb (one's mirth, arrogance etc)/to astringe/(math.) to converge
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to adapt (to an environment etc)/to make sth suitable/adaptation/adjustment/adaptive

grief and indignation
to remove/to step back from involvement/to disengage
pain (from wound)/sorrow
to realize suddenly/to wake up with a start
